sentence.Network_en: Mr Cooper looked fit and sunburnt.
sentence.Network_cn: 库珀先生皮肤黝黑，看起来很健康。

sentence.Network_en: The sunburnt grass breathed a harvest breath of dry sweetness and content.
sentence.Network_cn: 草给阳光晒枯了,发出一阵叫人意满心欢的收获期的芳香气息.

sentence.Network_en: Her sunburnt skin accentuates the fairness of her hair.
sentence.Network_cn: 她那晒黑了的皮肤突出了她的一头金发.

list.abs: dance and provencal song and sunburnt mirth ., 舞蹈 , 恋歌和灼热的欢乐.
The sunburnt sands drank water like a sponge ., 被太阳晒烫的沙子像海绵一样吸收水份.
one ' s sunburnt face ., 晒黑的脸.
Sunning himself in the sun made his body sunburnt ., 在太阳下晒日光浴使他的皮肤晒黑了.

entry.tran: 晒伤的;皮肤被太阳灼伤的
entry.def: Someone who is sunburnt has sore bright pink skin because they have spent too much time in hot sunshine.

example.ex: A badly sunburned face or back is extremely painful.
example.tran: 严重的脸部或背部晒伤会非常疼痛。

entry.tran: 晒得黝黑的;皮肤晒成深褐色的
entry.def: Someone who is sunburnt has very brown skin because they have spent a lot of time in the sunshine.

example.ex: Mr Cooper looked fit and sunburnt.
example.tran: 库珀先生皮肤黝黑，看起来很健康。

means.word_mean: 1. suffering from overexposure to direct sunlight

sentences.en: Turn over or your back will get sunburnt.
sentences.cn: 翻过身去,不然你的后背要被阳光灼伤的。

sentences.en: The skiing instructor was a tall, sunburnt man.
sentences.cn: 滑雪教练是一个高高个子晒得黑黑的男子。
